newsitem.title: PERU: 225 hostages to be released in Peru - ex-official.
newsitem.headline: 225 hostages to be released in Peru - ex-official.

text.p: Marxist rebels were prepares to release 225 hostages from the besieged Japanese embassy residence in Lima, former government official Sandro Fuente said in a guerrilla statement outside the residence.
Fuente was among four hostages released to read the statement.
In the statement, the guerrillas said they would make the large release of hostages as a gesture of good faith despite a "confrontational message" from President Alberto Fujimori on Saturday night.
Buses, police, firemen and mediators swarmed over the scene outside the besieged residence.
However the rebels gave no hint that a final end to the crisis was near.
Red Cross officials estimated that around 340 hostages were being held inside before the latest rebel statement.
